intro: Guatteria capixabae, commonly known as the Capixaba guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the Atlantic Forest region of Brazil, specifically found in the state of Espírito Santo. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically elliptical and have a glossy surface. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by dark blue berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
